intro: Syringa × rothomagensis metensis, commonly known as the Hungarian lilac, is a deciduous shrub or small tree native to Hungary. It features fragrant, clustered purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant has dark green, lance-shaped leaves that turn yellow in autumn. It thrives in full sun to partial shade and prefers well-drained soil. This species is valued for its ornamental beauty and adaptability to various garden conditions.
